semantic_title: Management of Dehydration Due to Malignancy
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 2. Chapter 2: Neoplasms > c. Coding and sequencing of complications > 3) Management of dehydration due to the malignancy

content.full_text: When the admission/encounter is for management of dehydration due to the malignancy and only the dehydration is being treated (intravenous rehydration), the dehydration is sequenced first, followed by the code(s) for the malignancy. (Evidence: pg no: 34, L40-L41)
content.summary: Sequencing guidelines for dehydration caused by malignancy when only dehydration is treated (Evidence: pg no: 34, L40-L41)
key_concepts: Dehydration due to malignancy (Evidence: pg no: 34, L40)
Only dehydration being treated (Evidence: pg no: 34, L40-L41)
Dehydration sequenced first (Evidence: pg no: 34, L41)
Malignancy code follows (Evidence: pg no: 34, L41)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Dehydration is sequenced first, followed by malignancy code(s) (Evidence: pg no: 34, L41)
detailed_rules.explanation: When treating dehydration caused by malignancy with only supportive care like IV rehydration, the dehydration takes precedence in sequencing (Evidence: pg no: 34, L40-L41)
common_applications: Patient with gastric cancer develops dehydration, admitted for IV fluids

workflow_steps: Step 1: Confirm dehydration is due to malignancy
